metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36427 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
GNOME gThumb before 3.10.1 allows an application crash via a malformed JPEGimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gthumb - 3:3.8.0-2.1ubuntu0.1
gthumb-data - 3:3.8.0-2.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gthumb package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3:3.8.0-2.1ubuntu0.1').
